results.title: Blokes and sheds - Mariano
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Mariano is a senior member of the rapidly growing South Australian Sudanese community, many of whom have arrived in Australia to seek refuge from their country that has been torn apart by civil war. Mariano lives with his family in public housing with a medium sized backyard. When Mariano pulls up the roller door of his shed, it is full – absolutely full of second-hand clothes, household utensils, furniture and appliances. Mariano collects and stores these items, which have been donated by the public, in his shed and distributes them to families who have recently arrived in Australia. As Mariano says: “I don’t make things in my shed. Or maybe I do… I am making a community!”. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Khai
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Khai is an established and well-respected contemporary furniture designer of Malaysian descent. Since he started out his 30-year relationship with furniture, first as an antique dealer, collector and restorer, then as a designer, Khai has discovered many styles of influence. Khai’s latest pieces have a distinctly Danish form. At the back of his retail shop, Khai’s basic galvanised iron shed/workshop is very simple and orderly – a reflection of his design sense. Lined with tools of the trade (chisels, hammers, sanding equipment etc) the shed also houses many projects in various stages of completion. Amongst the sounds of timber being sanded, hammered and polished we hear Khai recount his earlier years. He talks of how he started out and how, even as he travels the world collecting pieces, the place he longs to be is with his tools in the shed, wearing his apron. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Hossein
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Hossein is a well-known Iranian born artist who lives in suburban Adelaide. Hossein and his wife Angela, a ceramic artist, have created an idyllic studio space within the shed in their back garden. As their creativity has developed, changed form and grown, so to has the shed. The shed sits in their garden surrounded by the very source of materials that Hossein and Angela use for their projects. Using materials such as wooden branches, Japanese maple seeds, fern stems, rose petals and ginko leaves, they produce very intricate and delicate pieces that provoke thought. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Dimitri
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Dimitri lives in a suburban house in Adelaide. As we meet Dimitri we discover his intense love of Greek musical instruments. He is one of a few in Australia who makes bouzoukis, ouds and baglamas. We hear how Dimitri first got interested in his craft and how he made a special journey from Australia to Poland to learn from a master craftsman. Dimitri works in his brand new purpose built shed in the backyard, as he likes the flexibility of working all hours. We watch how Dimitri builds musical instruments and also welcomes and attracts his friends and colleagues to the shed to share in the unique sound of those instruments he loves and makes. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Des
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Des lives and works on his farming property in the historical German region of The Barossa Valley in South Australia. He has a hint of a German accent – all the more surprising since he is the third generation of his family born in Australia. There are many sheds on the property housing equipment that belonged to his father and grandfather before him. In a beautifully well-preserved hay thatched shed, a vast collection can be viewed as an almost historical “museum” to early farming technology. Des knows where everything is - although some of it has probably not been used for 20 or 30 years. But the equipment is still in working condition and we witness Des using a combination of that equipment as part of his working day. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Bruno
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Bruno has built a wooden oven in his shed. He fires the oven up early in the day, to bake the dough that he, his wife Guissepina, and his son Sam, have mixed up in a big wooden trough. By 9am the neighborhood smells of fresh bread as the beautiful rounded loaves are slid out of the oven on a long handled bread board before being eaten dipped in homemade olive oil and accompanied by other delicious flavors from the garden and of course, homemade wine. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.

results.title: Blokes and sheds - Attilio
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt
results.brief_description:
Oe of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia.
Attilio, a retired fitter and turner, is part of a powerful Italian tradition of high quality artisanship. He still works at home, doing small, specialised jobs. His basic galvanised iron shed is lined with tools of the trade - boxes and shelves filled with mostly metallic bits and pieces that get pieced together with absolute passion and craft. Attilio is also an entertainer - a funny guy and the life of the party. He has produced many CDs of his songs and is regularly booked for events by the South Australian Italian community. Attilio’s taverna is an open-sided room with a big table and a gas stove at one end - complete with an espresso machine for making short blacks (sometimes with a dash of the grappa!). In his taverna Attilio spends time with his brother Joe and his friends, enjoying Italian food and the fruits of his other labour – wine making. So Attilio’s backyard has two sheds – one for sharing friendship and entertainment, the other for the serious work. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: SBS Independent, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission, Mark Thomson, Sarah Wishart and Robi Watt

results.title: Blocks (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: G.A. Howe and MacMillan Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how constructive play with blocks of different shapes and sizes can be used to foster the basic perceptive skills and to develop logical thinking, concepts of height, eye-hand co-ordination, symmetry and balance.

results.title: Block printing
results.creator_credit: Arthur Browning, Edward T. Hall and Garrison Films
results.brief_description: Shows first a few examples of block printing of fabrics and then demonstrates how the block is made. Displays the tools needed and their uses.

constellations_other.name: Newsreel to nightly news
constellations_other.description: For decades, newsreel companies covered the news, providing weekly stories of current events, sport, and entertainment to audiences at the cinema, and establishing the format that would be taken up by television and the nightly news.
